intro: Guettarda dealbata, commonly known as the white guettarda, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically glossy and elliptical, providing a dense canopy that supports various forms of epiphytic life. Guettarda dealbata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in landscaping due to its hardy nature and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
